document_data.name: El Nallojal
document_data.Organization:
The lowest ranking officers of el Nallojal had the title of ''amhir'' and served as commanders. The captain of a ship had the title of ''rysal''. Fleet admirals were titled ''ralbahr''. An ''amhir'' was at first considered part of the lower class, while those holding the other two ranks were considered a part of the upper class of Calimshan. By [[1374 DR]], amhirs were treated as nobles as well.

Naval uniforms were colored bright pink and yellow. Sailors in el Nallojal wore ''[[keffiyeh]]'' with fish-shaped badges on them. Marines wore cork helmets with brass rims covered in turbans. The ''rysals'' wore special plumed turbans.

Members of el Nallojal had equal social standing in Calimshan with members of the other military forces, although some sultans and traders whose financial stability depended on the sea granted more standing to the navy.

In the capital city of [[Calimport]], troublemakers in [[Armada Ward]] were known to be arrested and press-ganged into service as sailors in the navy, forced to serve three-month tours of duty.

In [[1370 DR]], the head of el Nallojal was Syl-Ralbahr [[Mond el Vitendi]], Sultan of [[Teshburl]], a personal friend of [[Syl-pasha|Syl-Pasha]] [[Ralan el Pesarkhal]]. Sultan Mond was advised by Vizar [[Apu el Jhodan]], his former cabin boy. Syl-Ralbahr Vitendi answered to Sultan [[Fahd el Pesarkhal]] who was the supreme commander of all the armed forces of Calimshan under his father.
document_data.Base of Operations:
The primary docks for el Nallojal were located in the port town of Teshburl, but by the late 14{{th}} century [[DR]], all of the Calishite port cities had special piers and wharves for the ships of the navy, and at least a dozen vessels were always moored in each. More than 30 ships were docked in the cities of [[Almraiven]], Calimport, [[Memnon]], and Teshburl.

Sailors and marines of el Nallojal were quartered in buildings known as ''sadidah'' within port districts of Calishite cities.
document_data.Decorations:
El Nallojal awarded decorations to its troops and sailors who had demonstrated bravery or other favorable things, such as simply surviving a conflict. Known decorations in order of increasing prestige included:
* Sword of the [[Syl-Pasha]] — an embroidered badge awarded for being wounded
* Howl of the Black Horde — an embroidered badge awarded for skill during training
* Chains of [[Harakhti]] — an embroidered badge awarded for service in a battle
* Torch of the Seven Burnings — an embroidered badge awarded for service in a campaign
* Axe of [[Shanatar]] — an embroidered badge
* Eye of the [[Beholder]] — an embroidered badge
* Quarrel of the Night — an embroidered badge
* Fire of [[Memnon (efreeti)|Memnon]] — a reddish gold [[sash]]
* Breath of [[Calim]] — a silvery-gold sash
document_data.History:
The navy was first formed in the [[Second Age of Calimshan]] during the [[Tavihr Dynasty]], ''circa'' {{Yearlink|-2600}}, when the reed boats used for trade along the coasts were converted into vessels of war and used to spread the empire.

When that dynasty fell in {{Yearlink|-2381}}, the use of boats for war had fallen into disuse, but the practice was started again around {{Yearlink|-1150}} during the time of the [[Drakhon Dynasty]] in the [[Third Age of Calimshan|Third Age]], being commissioned by Syl-Pasha [[Kamal el Drakhon]]. The Imperial Navy grew to control the [[Shining Sea]] and the entire [[Lake of Steam region]] at that time, and this naval domination lasted for 700 years. The navy also aided in transporting troops quickly in the war against the [[beholder]]s of the [[Alimir Mountains]].

El Nallojal was also responsible for the spread of the empire during its "colonial era" in the [[Fourth Age of Calimshan|Fourth Age]]. During this time period, the ships of the navy were being made with wood instead of bundles of reed, and this technological advancement allowed Calimshan to reach as far as [[Chult]] and [[Tashalar]] for trade.

The navy had a surge in growth during the reign of Empress [[Shoon V]], giving the Imperium more control over the [[Chultan Peninsula]].

The Calishite navy was once the empire's greatest strength, but it fell apart over time. After a long period of nonexistence, el Nallojal was re-founded by [[Syl-pasha|Pasha]] [[Rashid el Djenispool]], and he took great pride in it. His successor, Ralan el Pesarkhal, saw it only as a tool to consolidate his power in the region, but it had grown large enough by the time of his rule to worry nations even in the [[Western Heartlands]] and [[the North]], reaching over 150 ships.

In [[1360 DR]], what was to be the flagship of the navy, the great ''[[Pasha's Palace]]'', a warship 1,000 feet long and 100 feet wide, was sunk on its maiden voyage 90 miles southeast of [[Volothamp]] by a [[kraken]]. El Nallojal took more than ten years to recover from this loss.

After the discovery of [[Maztica]] by [[Amn]], el Pesarkhal sent at least six naval ships per year to try to claim land on that great continent south of the area claimed by Amn. None of the ships sent ever returned.
